describe: Guinea, located on the west coast of Africa, is known for its rich natural resources, diverse cultures, and vibrant landscapes. The country is characterized by its lush rainforests, mountainous regions, and a coastline along the Atlantic Ocean.

cities.name: üèù Conakry
cities.geographical_location: Located on the Atlantic coast, Conakry is the capital and largest city of Guinea.
cities.climate: Conakry has a tropical monsoon climate with a wet season from May to November and a dry season from December to April.
cities.famous_cuisine: Famous dishes include Poulet Yassa (chicken marinated with onions and lemon) and Jollof rice.

cities.name: üèô Kankan
cities.geographical_location: Situated in eastern Guinea, Kankan is the largest city in the Kankan Region.
cities.climate: Kankan experiences a tropical savanna climate with distinct wet and dry seasons.
cities.famous_cuisine: Local specialties include rice with peanut sauce and grilled fish.

cities.name: üèî Lab√©
cities.geographical_location: Located in the Fouta Djallon region, Lab√© is known for its scenic landscapes.
cities.climate: Lab√© has a subtropical highland climate with cooler temperatures due to its elevation.
cities.famous_cuisine: Dishes like Fouti (a type of stew) and various millet-based meals are popular.
